item.title: ruby学习笔记
item.description: regular expressions =~是用于正则表达式的匹配操作符。返回匹配到的字符串位置或nil。 1"abcdef" =~ /d/ # return 3 2"aaaaaa" =~ /d/ # return nil !和? The exclamation point (!, sometimes pronounced aloud as “bang!”) indicates something potentially destructive, that is to say, something that can change the value of what it touches. ruby> s1 = "forth" "forth" ruby> s1.chop! # This changes s1. "fort" ruby> s2 = s1.chop # This puts a changed copy in s2, "for" ruby> s1 # .
